author: Miriam Zarriga
title: Christianity used in sorcery accusations - POST-COURIER
text:
Sorcery accusations in 2023 rose to an all-time high as 400 people were accused of sorcery with religion now used to raise accusations against others.
And from the 400 about 65 people accused of sorcery were killed.
The statistics were presented by the Parliamentary Committee on Gender Based Violence Chairman Powes Parkop to parliament early this year.
The data was collected from an Inquiry conducted by the Committee.
However, among all the accusations, the tortures, the videos, and the pictures, the churches have now been pulled into the sinister world of Sorcery with some of the accusers quoting scriptures and accusing women and the vulnerable as those practicing witchcraft.
And one of the cases covered extensively by the Post-Courier was the story of mother of five Lorna Nico.
Nico was a woman from Sohe, Northern Province who fell in love with a man from Mumeng, Morobe province, left her family behind and started a family with her husband and his people.
They were happy until the end of August of this year.
As her 8-year-old watched, Lorna was stripped and tortured dying of her injuries and then her body left out to the elements of the sun and insects until the evening when her body was removed and buried.
She was identified after a â€˜prayer warriorâ€ from one of the churches accused her of having satanic powers and bringing bad luck to the community.
Lorna didnâ€™t know this woman nor was she part of the church the woman was from.
However, she was pointed out allegedly because she was from another province.
Bishop of the Evangelical Lutheran Church Reverand Jack Urame spoke about the dangers
of â€œmixing religion and sorceryâ€.
â€œThis is not what the bible taught us, there is a shift in people using Christianity to identify suspected sorcerers which was now being used to destroy families and commit murders.â€
Using Christianity as a means to enact killings against those accused of sorcery is an idea condemned by the churches,â€ he further stated.
But the voice of a leader of a church is worrying because PNG has been declared by the government as a Christian nation.
As a nation much is still needed to be done in terms of ridding accusations of sorcery and killings associated with sorcery.
In the city of Port Moresby, a man who had cancer recently died with his family accusing a relative of causing his mouth cancer by giving him betelnut that was tainted.
This result in the burning of homes and the assault of one man who was only a neighbor to
the accused.
Speaking to those who live in the community it was surprising that the support was given to the relatives of the deceased.
Not even the church was spared, as the deceased relatives accused the church of interfering in a matter, they knew nothing off.
Christianity continues to be the belief across the country but when it becomes part of the sorcery accusations, police are worried with the rise in such accusations using the church.
Police Commissioner David Manning said; â€œIt is sickening to see these profiteers of death now calling themselves prayer warriors, misusing mainstream Christian faith for their brutal and bloody ends.
â€œOne of the most effective ways of preventing these sorcery crimes is through police working with community leaders and churches.â€â€™
â€œGlasman or glasmerisâ€ used their connections to churches to accuse those they believed were practicing witchcraft.
â€œPolice are targeting glasmen, glasmeris and prayer warriors, and stopping these criminals is an important part of law enforcement relating to sorcery.â€
Police are working with churches and community groups to provide more effective safe houses once survivors and their families escape or are rescued, he added.
For now, more needs to be done in the fight against sorcery.

organizations.name: parliamentary committee on gender based violence

author: VNExplorer
title: Diputada SantibÃ¡Ã±ez celebra decisiÃ³n de la U de despedir a Campos y manda directo recado a ByN por no hacer lo mismo con Thompson
text:
Marisela SantibÃ¡Ã±ez valorÃ³ esta tarde la decisiÃ³n de Azul Azul, de desvincular inmediatamente de Universidad de Chile a su arquero CristÃ³bal Campos, denunciado esta semana por su expareja de violencia intrafamiliar (VIF).
El anuncio del cuadro laico se hizo efectivo este miÃ©rcoles, en un escueto comunicado en sus plataformas digitales donde se aclarÃ³ que el tÃ©rmino de la relaciÃ³n contractual con el jugador, que tenÃ­a vigencia por un aÃ±o mÃ¡s, habÃ­a llegado luego de â€œuna evaluaciÃ³n general del Clubâ€.
El recado de SantibÃ¡Ã±ez a Colo Colo â€œEl Club Universidad de Chile informa que el jugador CristÃ³bal Campos VÃ©liz no continuarÃ¡ formando parte de nuestra instituciÃ³n. SegÃºn lo conversado con el futbolista de 24 aÃ±os, y tras una evaluaciÃ³n general del Club, se definiÃ³, en conocimiento de ambas partes, poner tÃ©rmino al vÃ­nculo contractual que lo ligaba con la instituciÃ³n hasta fines de 2024â€³, seÃ±alÃ³ la concesionaria, declaraciÃ³n que la diputada comunista celebrÃ³ en sus cuentas oficiales de Instagram y la red social X, ya que a su juicio, la instituciÃ³n deportiva â€œpor fin estÃ¡ entendiendoâ€ la gravedad de la violencia en contra de las mujeres.
â€œPorque la nobleza obliga, hoy destacamos a Universidad de Chile. Como colocolina me defino â€˜de sangre altiva y noble corazÃ³nâ€™. Que se haya desvinculado a su exarquero, investigado por violencia intrafamiliar (VIF), da cuenta que por fin estÃ¡n entendiendoâ€, escribiÃ³ la parlamentaria, quien en su publicaciÃ³n no dejÃ³ pasar el hecho para comparar la reacciÃ³n de los universitarios con la de Colo Colo, que en el caso de la denuncia por femicidio frustrado en contra de Jordhy Thompson optaron por mantener al jugador en su instituciÃ³n, pese a que la vÃ­ctima -su expareja- lo acusÃ³ en reiteradas oportunidades de haberla agredido fÃ­sica y psicolÃ³gicamente.
â€œSeÃ±ores de ByN Â¡No es necesario ir a la universidad para entender el respeto por las leyes! #DeporteSinAbusosâ€, concluyÃ³.

author: SchoolTube Community
title: Essential Items for Your Go Bag: A Comprehensive Guide | SchoolTube
text: Essential Items for Your Go Bag In the face of unexpected events, preparedness is key. Having a go bag, also known as an emergency kit, can make all the difference in navigating challenging situations. Whether itâ€™s a natural disaster, a power outage, or an unforeseen emergency, a well-stocked go bag provides essential supplies to ensure your safety and well-being. Why is a Go Bag Important? A go bag serves as a lifeline in times of crisis. It allows you to evacuate quickly and efficiently, carrying vital items that may not be readily available during an emergency. Imagine a scenario where you have to leave your home abruptly due to a wildfire or a sudden flood. A go bag ensures you have access to critical necessities like food, water, first-aid supplies, and essential documents, minimizing the impact of the situation. Essential Items for Your Go Bag Hereâ€™s a comprehensive list of essential items to include in your go bag: Basic Needs - Water: Pack at least one gallon of water per person per day for a minimum of three days. Consider using water purification tablets or a filter to extend your water supply. - Food: Include non-perishable food items that require no cooking, such as canned goods, energy bars, nuts, and dried fruit. Opt for food with a long shelf life. - First-Aid Kit: Assemble a basic first-aid kit with essential supplies like bandages, antiseptic wipes, pain relievers, and antibiotic cream. Customize it based on your specific needs and medical conditions. - Shelter: Pack a lightweight tarp, sleeping bag, or blanket for temporary shelter. Consider a portable camping tent if space permits. - Clothing: Include warm and comfortable clothing suitable for various weather conditions. Pack a change of clothes, socks, and a hat. Safety and Communication - Flashlight and Batteries: Ensure you have a reliable flashlight and extra batteries. Consider a multi-purpose flashlight that doubles as a radio or a power bank. - Whistle: A whistle can be used to signal for help in case of an emergency. - Emergency Radio: A weather radio can provide updates on emergency situations and warnings. Choose a radio that operates on multiple frequencies, including AM, FM, and NOAA Weather Radio. - Cell Phone Charger: Pack a portable phone charger to keep your phone operational. Consider a solar charger for extended power. Personal Items and Documents - Identification: Carry copies of your driverâ€™s license, passport, and any other essential identification documents. Store these documents in a waterproof bag or container. - Cash: Keep a small amount of cash on hand, as ATMs may be unavailable during an emergency. - Medications: Pack a list of your medications, dosages, and any allergies. Include a supply of your essential medications in a clearly labeled container. - Important Documents: Keep copies of important documents, such as insurance policies, medical records, and financial statements, in a waterproof bag. Tips for Organizing Your Go Bag - Choose the Right Bag: Select a durable and waterproof backpack or duffel bag thatâ€™s comfortable to carry and has enough space for your supplies. - Organize and Label: Pack your items in waterproof bags or containers and label them clearly. This helps you locate items quickly in an emergency. - Practice and Rotate: Regularly practice packing and unpacking your go bag to ensure youâ€™re familiar with its contents. Rotate food and water supplies every six months to maintain freshness. - Store in an Accessible Location: Keep your go bag in a designated location thatâ€™s easily accessible in case of an emergency. Preparing a go bag is an essential step in ensuring your safety and well-being during unforeseen events. By following these guidelines and including the necessary items, youâ€™ll be better equipped to face challenges and navigate difficult situations with confidence.

author: Shayak Majumder
title: Saw The Launch Of Enron's Nuclear Reactor 'Egg' On Social Media? Well, It's Fake
text:
A website bearing the old Enron logo introduced the fictitious device, touting it as the future of home energy under the tagline â€œNuclear you can trust.â€ Source : Enron If you are a tech enthusiast and keep checking out posts from bloggers, reviewers, and publications on the topic, chances are that you must have already come across posts on "Enron Egg," a supposed micro nuclear reactor designed to power homes for a decade. However, before you ditch your electricity provider, there's a catch â€” itâ€™s entirely fake.
This parody product was created by a mock version of Enron, the infamous energy company that collapsed in a historic accounting scandal in 2001.
Meet The Enron Egg, the worldâ€™s first at-home nuclear reactor. Watch the historic reveal. pic.twitter.com/VUHbuuBwjA
â€” Enron (@Enron) January 6, 2025
Nuclear You Can Trust? A website bearing the old Enron logo introduced the fictitious device, touting it as the future of home energy under the tagline â€œNuclear you can trust.â€ The satirical product description highlighted features like a heat-resistant casing to ensure durability and safety, as well as an integrated chip for 24/7 monitoring by a "nuclear management facility."
Adding to the parody, a launch video showcased fake company executives hyping the egg-shaped reactor on stage, complete with dramatic visuals and an enthusiastic faux audience. One supposed testimonial came from Connor Gaydos, co-author of Birds Arenâ€™t Real, who jokingly claimed, â€œIâ€™ve been living with an Egg for a few months now, and let me just tell you that my little ones, they freakinâ€™ love it, especially when what we save on the energy bill we can spend on Christmas presents.â€
Netizens Participate Social media users were quick to embrace the humour.
The gentleman during the product knowledge event was amazing, and had an oddly familiar look! Great conference. Would love to attend the next one.
â€” Stockstradamos (@_cannafit_) January 6, 2025
@ShawnRyan762 looks like nuclear fusion does exist
â€” Cristina B (@HandleThisLater) January 6, 2025
After playing through multiple fallout games, I donâ€™t know if this is such a good idea fam ðŸ˜„
â€” Mike (@Cefu_0804) January 7, 2025
A Nod To Enronâ€™s Troubled History The parody is a tongue-in-cheek nod to Enronâ€™s infamous downfall, which wiped out over $60 billion in assets and led to major financial regulations. The companyâ€™s fraudulent practices became a symbol of corporate greed and mismanagement.
While the Enron Egg may be a spoof, nuclear power is a hot topic in the tech world, with companies exploring it as a solution to growing energy demands. However, real-world adoption still faces challenges such as high costs, regulatory hurdles, and concerns over nuclear safety.
For those who missed the joke, the Enron.com site includes disclaimers describing the content as â€œrepresents performance art and is for entertainment purposes only,â€ reported Forbes. Even the siteâ€™s playful acrostic poem hints at its satirical nature, assigning ironic adjectives like "repentant" and "nice" to Enronâ€™s name.
In the end, the Enron Egg stands as a clever commentary on both corporate scandals and the gullibility of the internet age, reminding us to double-check before taking any viral sensation at face value.

author: Lauren Watson
title: Retired Marine and cancer survivor celebrates remission with 10-hour swim
text: COLORADO SPRINGS, Colo. ( KKTV /Gray News) - A retired Marine and cancer survivor in Colorado celebrates the anniversary of his remission with a feat he picked up during his service. Michael LaBarge said he was diagnosed with glioblastoma multiforme, grade IV brain cancer, 21 years ago on April 2. LaBarge said he has been in remission for a while and that he swims for 10 hours on the anniversary to celebrate it. â€œThe prognosis was two weeks to 10 months â€¦ 21 years ago,â€ he told KKTV . â€œI did this a lot in the Marines. [Today,] I started at 6 a.m., stopping at 4 p.m.â€ He completed his swim this year at the U.S. Air Force Academyâ€™s Community Pool in Colorado Springs. Chris Gesterling, the USAFA Pool Aquatics Manager, said he often sees LaBarge at the pool, and his story of surviving cancer is inspiring. â€œFormer Marine ... you know, he beat brain cancer so everything is possible for him,â€ Gesterling said. As LaBarge swam, he also shared his message for those fighting similar battles to the one he faced. â€œHopefully, this will inspire people with cancer to get out, stay active and, you know, donâ€™t get too down on themselves,â€ he said. Copyright 2024 KKTV via Gray Media Group, Inc. All rights reserved.

text:

El presidente estadounidense,
https://rpp.pe/mundo/europa/joe-biden-presidente-de-eeuu-se-hace-viral-por-inusual-gesto-en-ceremonia-oficial-noticia-1560028, descartÃ³ este viernes indultar a su hijo Hunter en caso de que este llegue a ser condenado en el juicio iniciado esta semana por compra y posesiÃ³n ilegal de un arma en 2018.
En una entrevista concedida a ABC News, el mandatario afirmÃ³ con un escueto "sÃ­" que respetarÃ¡ el veredicto.
Es la primera vez en la historia de
Estados Unidos que el hijo de un mandatario en activo se enfrenta a un juicio que, en este caso, puede afectar a la campaÃ±a de Joe Biden en las presidenciales del 5 de noviembre ya que los republicanos, especialmente el expresidente Donald Trump (2017-2021), lo utilizan con frecuencia como arma arrojadiza en su contra.
Hunter Biden es hijo de la primera esposa del presidente, la fallecida Neilia Biden, y estÃ¡ acusado de mentir en octubre de 2018 cuando no reconociÃ³ que consumÃ­a drogas en un formulario para comprar un revÃ³lver Colt Cobra de calibre 38, que luego guardÃ³ durante 11 dÃ­as.
El proceso comenzÃ³ el lunes en Wilmington (Delaware) y despuÃ©s de que este miÃ©rcoles declararan su exesposa, Kathleen Buhle, y una exnovia, Zoe Kestan, este jueves se sentÃ³ en el banquillo Hallie Biden, viuda de su hermano Beau Biden, fallecido de cÃ¡ncer en 2015, y con quien Hunter tuvo una relaciÃ³n extramarital tras el fallecimiento de Beau.
Hijo de Joe Biden se defiende
Hallie Biden dijo haberse asustado cuando encontrÃ³ la pistola en el coche de Hunter y admitiÃ³ haber empezado a consumir crack de cocaÃ­na despuÃ©s de que este la introdujera a esa droga: "Fue una experiencia terrible de la que me avergÃ¼enzo. Lamento ese periodo de mi vida", seÃ±alÃ³.
Sin embargo, seÃ±alÃ³ no haberle visto consumir drogas en la Ã©poca en la que comprÃ³ y tuvo el arma en cuestiÃ³n.
https://rpp.pe/mundo/estados-unidos/joe-biden-firma-orden-ejecutiva-que-limita-solicitudes-de-asilo-en-frontera-de-eeuu-noticia-1559441 no ha acudido a la corte, pero el lunes, cuando se seleccionÃ³ el jurado, sÃ­ estuvo presente la primera dama, Jill Biden, que justo ese dÃ­a cumpliÃ³ 73 aÃ±os.
En un comunicado, no obstante, el mandatario demÃ³crata apuntÃ³ que como presidente no iba a hacer ningÃºn comentario sobre casos federales pendientes, pero que como padre tenÃ­a un "amor ilimitado" por su hijo, "confianza en Ã©l y respeto por su fuerza".
Los tres cargos que se le imputan a Hunter Biden por la compra y posesiÃ³n ilegal de un arma al haber mentido sobre su adicciÃ³n conllevan una pena mÃ¡xima de 25 aÃ±os de cÃ¡rcel, si bien las sentencias suelen ser menores para quienes, como Ã©l, carecen de antecedentes penales.

author: Onmanorama Staff
title: Internal marks row: CUK drops dean from redressal panel after HC flags conflict of interest
text:
Internal marks row: CUK drops dean from redressal panel after HC flags conflict of interest
Mail This Article
Kasaragod: The Central University of Kerala (CUK) has reconstituted its Student Grievance Redressal Committee, removing Prof Joseph Koyipally, after the Kerala High Court questioned how he could sit in judgment in a complaint filed against him.
The new Grievance Redressal Committee, reconstituted on June 20, has six members, including a student representative, and is headed by Prof Arun Kumar K of the Department of Plant Science.
The move came in compliance with the court's interim direction to the Vice Chancellor issued on June 9, in a writ petition filed by Nayanthara Thilak, a postgraduate student (2022â€“2024 batch) from the Department of English and Comparative Literature.
A year ago, on July 27, 2024, Thilak wrote to the Student Grievance Redressal Committee that her internal marks were unfairly reduced by Prof Koyipally and Dr Asha S, an associate professor and Head of the Department, after she attended a prestigious academic programme at Cornell University.
But soon after she filed the complaint, the then vice-chancellor in charge, Prof Vincent Mathew, reconstituted the Redressal Committee and included Prof Koyipally in it.
Prof Koyipally is the dean of the School of Languages and Comparative Literature, and has frequently stood in as the acting Vice-Chancellor during Prof Mathewâ€™s absence, a role that underscored his prominence within the university's hierarchy.
According to her legal team, the Grievance Redressal Committee never took up her complaint, forcing her to approach the High Court.
On June 9, 2025, High Court judge D K Singh directed the new Vice Chancellor, Professor Siddu P Algur, to "reconstitute the redressal cell in which the fifth respondent (Prof Koyipally) should not be associated at all..." The interim order further directed the Grievance Redressal Committee to hear both Prof Koyipally and the student before submitting its report.
The court will hear the case next on July 8.
Thilak, a topper in class, alleged that her internal marks were deliberately manipulated to prevent her from securing the top rank in her class.
On March 8, during CUK's eighth convocation, the first-rank holders of 26 of the universityâ€™s 27 departments were honoured. However, the Department of English and Comparative Literature did not announce its topper. Controller of Examinations Dr Jayaprakash R confirmed that the departmentâ€™s rank list had been withheld because of the courtâ€™s interim order on March 7 in Thilakâ€™s case.
According to the writ petition, faculty members Prof Koyipally and Dr Asha, the Head of the Department, awarded Thilak 49 out of 60 internal marks in English Language and Linguistics, the lowest in her class. This came after she attended a six-week Critical Theory Summer School at Cornell University, from June 9 to July 18, 2024, for which she had secured prior written permission from the university.
Thilak, a native of Kozhikode and a three-time class topper, alleged that her low marks were a form of academic retaliation. She noted that the 49 marks she received were the same as those awarded to a student who had been on maternity leave for several months, calling it "sufficient evidence of bias".
